originalTitle: 'Affront to humanity': Sudan slams Uganda for hosting RSF paramilitary boss
title: A Big Chat in Africa: What Made Sudan Upset?
content:
Hello, Africa!

Hi, super kids! Are you ready for some news from our amazing continent, Africa? Africa is a very big place, full of sunshine, cool animals, and lots of different people. Today, we are going to talk about two special countries in Africa: Sudan and Uganda. They are like neighbors, not too far from each other. Sometimes, even good neighbors can have a little disagreement. That's what we are going to learn about today! Did you know? Africa is the second-largest continent in the world! It has 54 different countries. Wow!

Meet Our Friends: Sudan and Uganda

Let's learn a little bit about Sudan first. Sudan is a big country in North Africa. It has a famous river called the Nile River. Many people live in Sudan, and they love their country very much. Like many countries, Sudan has a leader. This leader helps make important decisions for everyone. Now, let's talk about Uganda. Uganda is another beautiful country in East Africa. It is sometimes called the "Pearl of Africa" because it is so pretty! Uganda has big lakes and amazing animals like gorillas. Uganda also has its own leader, who helps to guide the country. Both Sudan and Uganda are part of our big African family. Did you know? The Nile River is the longest river in the world! It flows through many countries, including Sudan and Uganda.

What is the Big News?

Here is the important part of our story. Something happened that made Sudan a little bit sad and upset with Uganda. It's like when your friend plays with someone you're not getting along with, and it makes you feel strange. Uganda's leader recently met with a very important person. This person is the leader of a special group in Sudan. This group is called the Rapid Support Forces. That's a long name, isn't it? Let's just call them the RSF for short. Did you know? Leaders of countries often meet to talk about important things. They try to be good friends and help each other.

Who Are the RSF?

The RSF is a group of soldiers in Sudan. They are like a special army. But right now, the government of Sudan is not happy with the RSF. There has been some fighting in Sudan, and it makes everyone sad. The government of Sudan sees the RSF as a group that should not be fighting. They want peace and quiet for their country. So, when Uganda met with the leader of the RSF, it made the government of Sudan feel very worried. They felt like Uganda was not being a good friend to them. It's like if you had a problem with someone, and your best friend went and played with that person without telling you. You might feel a little bit hurt. Did you know? An army is a group of people who protect their country. They train very hard to keep everyone safe.

Why Is Sudan Upset?

Sudan is upset because they have some very important rules. These are not just school rules, but "international rules." These are big rules that all countries try to follow. These rules help countries be good neighbors and solve problems without fighting. Sudan believes that by meeting the RSF leader, Uganda might be breaking some of these important rules. Sudan thinks that countries should not talk to groups that are fighting against their own government. They believe this can make the fighting worse, not better. They want all countries to help Sudan find peace. They want everyone to encourage the RSF to stop fighting. So, when Uganda talked to the RSF leader, Sudan felt like Uganda was not helping them to find peace. Did you know? Countries have rules, just like families and schools. These rules help everyone live together happily and safely.

Rules for Friends

Imagine you and your friend have a secret club. You have special rules for your club. If another friend breaks one of those rules, it might make you feel disappointed. Countries are a bit like big clubs. They have rules to help everyone get along. One big rule is that countries usually talk to the leaders of other countries, not to groups that are fighting *inside* those countries. This helps to keep things fair and to show respect. Sudan feels that Uganda did not show respect for this rule. They think Uganda should have talked to the official government of Sudan instead. It's a tricky situation, just like when friends have a misunderstanding. But talking about it can help. Did you know? Many countries in Africa work together in a group called the African Union. They try to solve problems and make Africa strong and peaceful.

Why Talk is Important

Even though Sudan is upset, it's very important for countries to talk. Talking is how we solve problems, right? If you're upset with a friend, you talk to them. Countries do the same thing. Uganda's leader said that he met with the RSF leader to try and help bring peace to Sudan. Maybe Uganda thought that talking to all sides, even the RSF, could help stop the fighting. But Sudan feels that this was not the right way to help. It shows us that even with good intentions, sometimes things can get complicated. Everyone wants peace, but they might have different ideas about how to get there. Did you know? Talking things out is often called "diplomacy." It means finding a peaceful way to solve problems between countries.

What Happens Next?

Now, what happens after this big news? Sudan has told the world that they are not happy with Uganda. They hope that Uganda will understand their feelings. Sometimes, other countries or big groups like the African Union might step in to help. They might talk to both Sudan and Uganda. They will try to help them understand each other better. The goal is always to bring back friendship and make sure everyone follows the important rules. We all hope that Sudan and Uganda can work things out. We want all countries in Africa to be good friends and help each other. Did you know? When countries talk, they sometimes send special people called "ambassadors" to represent them. These ambassadors help keep the lines of communication open.

Let's Hope for Peace!

So, little reporters, we learned about a big news story today. It's about two countries, Sudan and Uganda, and a misunderstanding over who to talk to. It shows us how important it is to follow rules, be good friends, and always try to find peaceful ways to solve problems. We hope that Sudan finds peace very soon, and that all countries in Africa can continue to be great neighbors. Let's keep our fingers crossed for friendship and peace across our beautiful continent!
summary: Sudan is upset with Uganda because Uganda's leader met with the head of a fighting group in Sudan called the RSF, which Sudan believes breaks important rules for how countries should act as friends.
whyMatters: This matters because it shows how countries need to follow important rules and talk nicely to each other to help find peace and stop fighting, especially in Africa where we want all our neighbors to be friends.

originalTitle: Catch of the day: Pictures from spectacular Nigerian fishing festival
title: Super Fun Fishing Day in Nigeria!
content:
Hello everyone! I'm your friendly news reporter for Africa. I have some very exciting news from a beautiful country called Nigeria! Imagine a big party, but with lots and lots of fish! This is what happened at the Argungu Fishing Festival.

What is a Festival?

A festival is like a super big celebration! People come together from many towns and villages. They sing songs, dance, tell stories, and play games. It's a special time to remember important things and have fun together. This festival in Nigeria celebrates fishing and friendship. Did you know? Nigeria is a very big country in Africa! It has many different groups of people, and they all have special ways to celebrate!

The Big Fishing Day

Imagine hundreds of people standing by a wide river. They are all excited! They wait for a special signal, like a big drum beat or a whistle. Then, SPLASH! Everyone jumps into the water at the same time to catch fish. It's a wonderful sight! The river fills with people all looking for the biggest fish. Everyone is laughing and having a great time, even though they are trying to win!

Ready, Set, Fish!

How do they catch the fish? They don't use regular fishing rods like you might see. People use special tools. Some use large, woven nets that they throw into the water. Others use big gourds. Did you know? A gourd is like a very big, hollow fruit! When it dries, people can use it like a bowl or even a small boat! They put their hands inside the gourds to feel for fish. They also use their bare hands! It takes a lot of skill and quick hands to catch fish this way. These fishermen are very, very good at what they do.

Who Can Fish?

Only certain people are allowed to join the main fishing competition. These are usually local fishermen who have been fishing in the river for many years. It's a very old and special tradition in their community. Many boys and girls watch from the river banks. They cheer for their parents, uncles, and friends. It's a really exciting day for everyone, not just the people in the water.

Finding the Biggest Fish

Everyone wants to catch the biggest fish! The person who catches the heaviest fish is the winner. This fish can be very, very big and heavy, sometimes even bigger than a child! Did you know? Some fish in rivers can grow to be longer than a grown-up's arm and weigh many pounds! Imagine trying to pull one of those out of the water! The winner gets a really big prize. But more than the prize, they get a lot of honor and respect from everyone. It's a friendly competition, and everyone celebrates the winner.

More Than Just Fishing: It's About Peace!

This festival is not just about catching fish. It's about something even more important: peace! Long, long ago, the people from different towns and villages sometimes argued. Did you know? Peace means everyone is happy together, there are no fights, and people are kind to each other. The Argungu Fishing Festival was started a very long time ago to help everyone become friends again. It was a way to make sure people lived together without fighting. By fishing together, they learned to trust and help each other.

Making Friends and Keeping Peace

When people come together for the festival, they laugh, share food, and fish side-by-side. It reminds everyone to be kind, be friends, and live in peace. This tradition has helped keep peace for many, many years in the area. It shows us that even big celebrations can have a very important message for everyone. This festival helps keep the community strong and happy.

Traditions and More Fun!

There's more to see than just fishing! Before and after the big fish catch, there are other exciting things happening. There are boat races where people paddle very fast. There are swimming competitions, and sometimes even wrestling matches! Did you know? Nigeria has many amazing traditions, like beautiful music, energetic dancing, and wonderful storytelling! People wear their most beautiful clothes, called traditional attire. They play drums and other musical instruments, and everyone dances! It's a truly joyful time for all the families who come.

Sharing Stories and Learning Together

Grandparents tell stories about past festivals to children. Old friends meet and give big hugs. New friends are made as children play together. This festival helps people understand each other better. When they celebrate together, they learn about each other's cultures and ways of life. It helps them feel like one big family.

A Wonderful Celebration!

So, the Argungu Fishing Festival in Nigeria is a super special event. It's about amazing fishing skills, friendly competition, and most importantly, making sure everyone lives in peace and happiness. What a wonderful way to celebrate! It's a true treasure of Africa.
summary: Children in Africa learn about Nigeria's Argungu Fishing Festival, a fun event where people catch fish and celebrate peace and friendship.
whyMatters: This festival is important because it brings many people together, helps them make friends, and reminds everyone to live in peace, showing how traditions can make communities strong and happy.

originalTitle: Rare prison sentences handed to Cameroon soldiers after killing of 21 civilians
title: Rare prison sentences handed to Cameroon soldiers after killing of 21 civilians
content: In a rare occurence, three soldiers were handed jail terms for killings in the troubled Anglophone region.

originalTitle: France to summon US ambassador over comments on far-right activist’s death
title: France and USA Have a Serious Chat!
content:
Hello from Your African News Friend!

Hello everyone! It’s your friendly African news reporter here, bringing you a story from far, far away! Today, we are going to talk about two big countries. They are called France and the United States of America. Most people call the United States of America just "the USA" for short.

Countries Are Like Friends

These two countries, France and the USA, are usually very good friends. They have been friends for a very, very long time. Think of them like you and your best friend at school. You play together, you help each other, and you try to be kind. But sometimes, even the best of friends might have a little disagreement. Maybe one friend says something, and the other friend feels a bit sad or upset about it. That’s okay! Friends can talk things out to make everything good again.

What is a Special Talk?

Something like that happened recently between France and the USA. France asked a very special person from the USA to come and have a serious talk. This special person is called an ambassador. It’s like when your mum or dad asks you to sit down and talk about something important. It means they want to understand something, or they want you to understand something.

Meet the Ambassador!

So, who is an ambassador? An ambassador is like a very important helper! Every big country sends a special grown-up to live in another big country. Imagine someone from your country going to live in France or the USA! This person’s job is to be super-friendly with the new country. They help their home country and the new country get along well. They tell their home country what is happening in the new country. They also help people from their home country if they need help in the new place. It’s like having a special friend in another school who tells your teacher what's happening there! They make sure everyone stays connected and understands each other. Did you know? France is a country in Europe! It is famous for the Eiffel Tower, which is a very tall and beautiful building in its capital city, Paris! People in France also love to eat yummy bread called baguettes. Did you know? The USA is a very big country far away. It is famous for Hollywood movies where you see many amazing films! It also has very big cities like New York.

Sad News in France

Now, let’s talk about the sad part of our story. In France, a person named Quentin Deranque sadly passed away. This means he died. When someone dies, it is a very, very sad time for their family and friends. Everyone feels sad and wants to be respectful to the person who has passed and to their loved ones. It’s a time for quietness and for thinking about the person who is no longer with us. People feel very, very sad, and they need comfort and kindness.

Words That Made France Unhappy

After Quentin Deranque died, some people from the USA said some things. These words were about his death. France heard these words, and they felt a bit upset and sad about them. France felt that the words from the USA were not kind for such a sad time. They thought that these words were not respectful to Quentin Deranque or his family. France felt like the USA was using the sad news to talk about other things. They thought the words were being used for what we call "political purposes."

What Does "Political Purposes" Mean?

"Political purposes" is a grown-up phrase. It means using something to talk about how a country should be run, or who should be in charge, or big arguments between groups of people. France thinks that when someone dies, it is not the right time for such talk. It is a time for sadness and respect, not for arguments or big ideas about government. Imagine if you were very sad because your favourite toy broke. And then your friend started talking about who should be the leader of your playtime. That wouldn’t feel very nice, would it? You would want them to understand your sadness first.

France Says "No!" to Unkind Words

An important person in France, who is like a very clever helper for the government, said something very clear. He is called a "top diplomat." He said that France does not want anyone to use Quentin Deranque's death for "political purposes." He meant that France wants everyone to be respectful. They want people to remember Quentin Deranque with kindness and sadness. They don't want anyone to use his passing as a reason to argue or talk about big government things. They want to make sure that people understand that sad times need respect. They want to protect the memory of Quentin Deranque and be kind to his family. Did you know? Respecting people's feelings, especially when they are sad or grieving, is very important everywhere in the world. It shows you care!

Why Is This Talk Important?

This talk between France and the USA is very important. It shows that even friends need to talk when they have problems. When countries talk, they try to understand each other’s feelings. France wants to make sure that everyone learns to be respectful. Especially during sad times, we should only say kind words or be quiet. We should not use someone’s death to talk about other things that can cause arguments. It's like when you have a small disagreement with a friend. You talk about it quietly, you listen to each other, and you try to make things better. You don't shout or ignore each other.

What Happens Next?

So, France asked the USA ambassador to come and have a chat. This is not about being angry and yelling at each other. It’s more like saying, "Hey friend, we need to talk about what happened. We are feeling a bit sad and upset about some of the things that were said." The goal of this chat is to make sure everyone understands. It's to make sure that France and the USA can continue to be good friends. It’s about reminding everyone about kindness and respect. Did you know? France and the USA have helped each other in many important times throughout history. They are very old friends! They want to keep their friendship strong.

Being Kind is Always Best

The main message from France is that being kind and respectful is always the best way. Especially when someone has passed away. It is a time for quiet sadness and thinking of the family. France wants to make sure everyone remembers Quentin Deranque in a respectful way. They want to make sure no one uses his sad passing for arguments or big political talks. It's about being kind to the family and friends who are sad.

Let’s All Be Kind!

So, that’s our story today! Two big friends, France and the USA, are having a serious but important chat. They are talking about being respectful and kind, especially during sad times. And that’s a good lesson for all of us, isn't it? Let’s all try to be kind, be respectful, and talk things out, just like good friends do!
summary: France asked a special helper from the USA (an ambassador) to come talk because France was sad and upset that some words were said about a person who died, feeling that sad times should not be used for arguments.
whyMatters: This matters because it teaches us that even big countries need to be kind and respectful, especially when someone is sad, and that it's always good for friends to talk things out when they have a problem.

title: 'Unforeseen circumstances' delay Aberdeen boss hunt

originalTitle: Guardiola tells team to chill with cocktails as Man City pile pressure on Arsenal
title: Guardiola tells team to chill with cocktails as Man City pile pressure on Arsenal
content: As Manchester City continue to crank up the pressure on Arsenal, Pep Guardiola tells his players to take three days off to "enjoy life" with "caipirinhas and daiquiris".
